name: 1Password
description: Securely stores team passwords and sensitive documents — perfect for sharing login access to donor platforms without risk.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for 1Password for non-profits and receive a 50% discount on all Team plans.

**How to apply:**
- [Fill out the form](https://1password.com/for-non-profits/) on the 1Password for non-profits page  
- Enter your organisation's details and submit your application  
- Youâ€™ll receive an email with instructions on how to activate your discounted plan once approved
hs_recommended_details: 1Password is a great option for non-profits that don’t have a dedicated IT team but still need to manage access to tools securely. It keeps all your logins in one place and makes it easy to share credentials with staff, volunteers, or board members without compromising security. If you're juggling lots of platforms or working with people who come and go, it can really reduce the risk of password sprawl. The nonprofit discount is generous too, which helps make strong security affordable. As with most password managers, it might take a little time to set up, but it's worth it for the peace of mind.

name: Airtable
description: Combines spreadsheet simplicity with database power — ideal for tracking volunteer applications or event RSVPs.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Airtable’s non-profit discount and receive 50% off on Plus or Pro plans.

**How to apply:**
- Set-up your free Airtable account  
- Submit your details through the non-profit [application form](https://airtable.com/appxYJgUmfMGaINKU/shr9DxhP6lU9slZE6?prefill_Application=Nonprofit&_gl=1*3ax7mp*_gcl_aw*R0NMLjE3NTE2NzQ3NjUuQ2owS0NRanc5NTNEQmhDeUFSSXNBTmhJWm9aVFF6T1poVy1MRW52clhzSTBjTGNwRWQzQWs2dG5ST1NMWVROdmpYN2F0VlZnWjRCX3N0UWFBbDhKRUFMd193Y0I.*_gcl_au*MTMyMjMwMzE0NC4xNzUxNTA0MDg2*_ga*MjA3NjcxMDY5Ny4xNzUxNTA0MDg3*_ga_VJY8J9RFZM*czE3NTIxMDkxODAkbzMkZzAkdDE3NTIxMDkxODAkajYwJGwwJGgw)  
- Once verified, Airtable will apply the discount to your workspace and notify you by email
hs_recommended_details: Airtable is a great option for non-profits that are still using spreadsheets like Excel to manage things like grants, volunteers, or events. It looks like a spreadsheet but works more like a database, so you can link information together, filter and sort with ease, and build simple workflows without writing code. It’s especially helpful when you’re tracking lots of moving parts and want to avoid version control issues or getting lost in complex formulas. The 50% nonprofit discount makes it more affordable than many other tools in this space. There is a learning curve if you’re used to traditional spreadsheets, but the time you save in the long run makes up for it.

name: Asana
description: Helps teams manage projects and tasks — for example, planning a fundraising campaign from idea to launch.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Asana’s non-profit discount program to receive 50% off Premium or Business plans.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Asana account  
- Visit the [Asana for non-profits page](https://asana.com/industry/nonprofit) and select your country  
- Submit your details through the application form via TechSoup or its local partner  
- Once verified, you'll receive a confirmation email with instructions on how to apply the discount to your account

name: Balsamiq
description: Quickly creates wireframes and mockups — useful when scoping a new website or donor portal.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for free access to Balsamiq Cloud, a rapid wireframing tool designed to help teams visualise and iterate on ideas quickly without the complexity.

**How to apply:**
- Visit the [Balsamiq for non-profits page](https://balsamiq.com/nonprofits/)  
- Fill out the application form with your organisation’s details  
- Once approved, you'll receive instructions to set up your free workspace and can start wireframing immediately!

name: Canva
description: Easy-to-use design tool for creating social media posts, flyers, or grant presentations without needing a graphic designer.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Canva for non-profits and get full access to Canva’s premium design tools, at no cost. You can invite up to 50 team members to join your account for free.

**How to apply:**
- [Fill out the form on the Canva for non-profits website](https://www.canva.com/nfp-signup)  
- Wait for Canva to verify your details  
- Once approved, you’ll get an email and can start using Canva Pro right away!
hs_recommended_details: We love Canva because it’s so versatile. Whether we’re designing posters, presentations, videos or social posts, it's a one-stop shop. The fact that it’s completely free for nonprofits is a huge win, and we love how easy their end-to-end features like the Print Shop are, making designing and printing assets for events and fundraising easy-breezy. That said, we do wish it were a bit easier to navigate. For what it offers, it’s an amazing tool we turn to daily.
affiliate_link: N/A - Canva have stopped their affiliate program

name: ChatGPT
description: Assists with drafting grant applications, summarising reports, or generating volunteer outreach emails in seconds.
non_profit_discount: 20% off Team Plans; 50% off Enterprise Plans for non-profits
non_profit_discount_link: 20% off Team Plans; 50% off Enterprise Plans for non-profits
pricing_details: 20% off Team Plans; 50% off Enterprise Plans for non-profits

name: Chuffed
description: A crowdfunding platform built for social causes — great for running a grassroots campaign to fund a specific local project.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.

name: ClickUp
description: All-in-one task and project management platform — perfect for coordinating a small team’s outreach, admin, and reporting tasks.
non_profit_discount: 10 free seats and 70% off additional seats for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for ClickUp’s non-profit discount to receive 35% off Unlimited and Business plans.

**How to apply:**
- [Set up your free ClickUp account](https://clickup.com/)  
- Submit your details through the [application form](https://clickup.com/teams/non-profit/discount)  
- Once verified, ClickUp will apply the discount to your workspace and notify you by email

name: Copper
description: A lightweight CRM that integrates seamlessly with Google Workspace — useful for tracking supporter engagement directly from Gmail.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.

name: Google Gemini
description: AI assistant for generating reports, drafting documents, or brainstorming project ideas — ideal for overstretched teams.
non_profit_discount: 75% off plans for non-profits upgrading for AI features
pricing_details:
Non-profits can access Google Gemini's AI capabilities through the Google Workspace for Non-profits program.

**How to apply:**
- Apply for the Google for Nonprofits programme  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for Non-profits from your account dashboard  
- Access Gemini features included in the no-cost Workspace for Non-profits plan  
- To unlock additional AI functionalities, upgrade to an advanced Google Workspace edition with discounts of up to 75% off the standard price
hs_recommended_details: Google’s Gemini AI Assistant can be a helpful support tool for non-profits looking to save time on admin, writing, and planning. It can help draft grant proposals, write donor thank-you letters, summarise reports, or even brainstorm ideas for events or newsletters. If you're not sure where to start, Google offers a [free Nonprofit Prompt Library](https://support.google.com/nonprofits/answer/15287523?hl=en-GB) with examples tailored to the kinds of tasks non-profits do every day. It’s available through the Google Workspace for Nonprofits programme, and many organisations can access it at no cost or at a significant discount. It’s not perfect and won’t replace your voice, but it’s a smart tool to have on hand when capacity is tight.

name: Ghost.org
description: Simple, elegant platform for publishing blog posts or newsletters — great for showcasing impact stories on your website.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can receive a 20% discount on all Ghost(Pro) plans by subscribing to an annual billing cycle.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Ghost (Pro) account by starting a 14-day trial at [Ghost.org](https://ghost.org/)  
- Choose an annual billing plan during the subscription process to automatically receive the 20% discount  

Note: Ghost is operated by a non-profit organisation and does not offer additional discounts beyond the annual billing reduction. However, the Ghost software is free and open-source, allowing you to self-host if preferred.
hs_recommended_details: Ghost is a great option for non-profits that want full control over their website, blog, or newsletter without being tied to big platforms. It’s open source, fast, and designed with publishing in mind, which makes it ideal for sharing updates, stories, and campaigns with your community. You can use it for both public content and member-only posts, and the built-in newsletter tools are a nice bonus. The 20% discount on annual plans helps keep it affordable, and you can also self-host it for free if you have the tech skills. It’s a more hands-on platform than something like Wix or Squarespace, but for teams that want flexibility and ownership, it’s a strong option.
affiliate_link: Requires a Ghost.org website to apply

name: GiveNow
description: Free platform for collecting online donations — ideal for small Australian charities wanting to fundraise without monthly fees.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can sign up for GiveNow to access an affordable digital fundraising platform.

**How to apply:**
- Visit the [GiveNow Plans & Pricing page](https://about.givenow.com.au/plans-and-pricing-2)  
- Select the plan that best suits your organisation's needs:  
-Starter Plan: 0% platform fee, ideal for basic donation processing  
-Basic Plan: 2.4% platform fee, includes additional features like custom donation forms and daily summary reports  
-Pro Plan: 3.25% platform fee, offers advanced features such as unlimited active causes and Salesforce integration  
- Sign up for free and set up your fundraising campaigns

name: GoFundMe
description: Crowdfunding tool for one-off campaigns — great for rallying community support after an emergency or local crisis.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for GoFundMe’s non-profit program to create a free page, enabling direct donations, supporter-led fundraising, and access to donor insights.

**How to apply:**
- Visit the GoFundMe for Non-profits page  
- Click “[Claim my Non-profit Page](https://www.gofundme.com/sign-up?redirect=/charity-sign-up)” and create an account  
- Submit the requested documentation to verify your non-profit status  
- Once approved (typically within 1–2 business days), your non-profit page will be live, and you can start fundraising immediately  


Note: GoFundMe charges no platform fees for non-profits; however, standard payment processing fees apply (typically 2.2%–2.5% + $0.30 per transaction). Donors are also invited to leave an optional tip to support GoFundMe's operations.

name: Google Maps
description: Embeds interactive maps on your website — helpful for showing project locations or listing environmental restoration sites.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Maps Platform credits through the Google for non-profits programme, receiving up to USD $250/month in Maps API credit to help build location-based services and tools.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details: Google Maps Platform can be a powerful resource for non-profits working with place-based data. We’ve used the Maps API in our citizen science apps and community reporting forms, helping people log sightings, issues, or activities in specific locations. It’s also useful for building maps of service areas, visualising impact, or helping donors and volunteers find local projects. The $250 USD monthly credit through Google for Nonprofits covers a lot of usage, especially for small to medium-scale projects. There is some setup involved, and you may need a developer to get started, but once it's in place, it opens up a lot of possibilities for interactive, map-based tools.

name: Google Meet
description: Simple, secure video meetings — used by remote teams or volunteer coordinators to host planning sessions and interviews.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Workspace for non-profits to receive free access to essential productivity tools, including Gmail, Google Drive, Google Meet, and more. Discounted rates are also available for Business Standard, Business Plus, and Enterprise editions.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details: Google Meet is a reliable, no-fuss video conferencing tool that’s included for free with Google Workspace for Nonprofits. It works seamlessly with other Google tools like Calendar and Gmail, so scheduling and joining meetings is simple for staff, volunteers, and board members. It’s a solid choice for team check-ins, remote collaboration, or even hosting webinars. If you’ve activated Gemini in your Workspace, you can also access features like live transcription, recordings, and AI-generated summaries. This is especially useful for governance meetings, saving time on note-taking and follow-ups. For non-profits already using Google tools, it’s an easy win.

name: Google Gmail
description: Email platform for daily communication — commonly used by non-profits to manage donor, partner, and internal emails.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Workspace for non-profits to receive free access to essential productivity tools, including Gmail, Google Drive, Google Meet, and more. Discounted rates are also available for Business Standard, Business Plus, and Enterprise editions.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details:
Gmail is included for free with Google Workspace for Nonprofits, and it’s much more than just email. It gives your team a professional setup with the option to use your own domain (like info@yourorganisation.org) instead of a personal @gmail.com address, which is great for building trust and keeping things consistent. It’s easy to manage even without an IT team, and perfect for onboarding staff, volunteers, or board members.

Beyond email, Gmail comes with useful built-in features like templates for no-code newsletters and event invites, automated filters and labels, and scheduled sending. It connects seamlessly with Google Calendar and Drive, making it simple to stay organised and collaborative. If you’re still using personal email accounts to run your non-profit, this is an easy and free upgrade that makes a big difference.

name: Google Sheets
description: Versatile spreadsheet tool for budgets, tracking impact, or maintaining mailing lists — easy to share with collaborators.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Workspace for non-profits to receive free access to essential productivity tools, including Gmail, Google Drive, Google Meet, and more. Discounted rates are also available for Business Standard, Business Plus, and Enterprise editions.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details:
Ah, Sheets! One of our favourite tools. Google Sheets is more than just a spreadsheet. It can be a database, a planning tool, a reporting dashboard, or an organising space for anything your non-profit needs. You can use it to manage volunteer rosters, grant pipelines, contact lists, budgets, project plans, or survey responses. And because it’s part of Google Workspace for Nonprofits, it’s free and integrates easily with Gmail, Forms, Calendar, and Drive.

One of the best things about Sheets is how easily it connects with other platforms. It works with hundreds of automation tools, so you can pull in data from forms, sync with email lists, or trigger actions without writing any code. If your organisation doesn’t need a full CRM, Sheets is often more than enough. It’s flexible, powerful, and easy for anyone on your team to use.

name: Google Forms
description: Creates surveys and forms — perfect for volunteer sign-ups, event RSVPs, or collecting post-program feedback.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Workspace for non-profits to receive free access to essential productivity tools, including Gmail, Google Drive, Google Meet, and more. Discounted rates are also available for Business Standard, Business Plus, and Enterprise editions.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details:
Google Forms is one of the simplest and most useful tools available to non-profits. Whether you're collecting RSVPs, feedback, volunteer sign-ups, survey responses, or grant data, it just works. It's easy to set up, easy to share, and all the responses feed straight into a connected Google Sheet. That makes reporting and follow-up a breeze, especially when combined with automation tools or conditional logic.

It’s included for free as part of Google Workspace for Nonprofits, so there’s no cost barrier to getting started. The only thing we don’t love is the limited design options — your forms won’t win any style awards. But for functionality, flexibility, and ease of use, it’s hard to beat. If your organisation needs to collect information from your community or team, Forms is a great place to start.

name: Google Drive
description: Cloud storage that keeps files organised and accessible — useful for storing funding applications, reports, and assets in one place.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Workspace for non-profits to receive free access to essential productivity tools, including Gmail, Google Drive, Google Meet, and more. Discounted rates are also available for Business Standard, Business Plus, and Enterprise editions.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details:
Google Drive is a must-have for non-profits that need a simple, secure place to store and share their files. It comes free with Google Workspace for Nonprofits and helps teams keep everything in one place, whether you’re managing funding applications, photos from events, policies, or meeting notes.

You can organise files into shared folders for staff, volunteers, or board members, and control who can view or edit each item. It’s especially handy for remote teams or part-time staff who need access to documents without digging through inboxes or hard drives. You can also collaborate in real time on Docs, Sheets, and Slides, which means no more version control issues or lost changes.

It’s easy to use, works on any device, and reduces the need for expensive file storage or clunky email chains. If your non-profit is still juggling USB sticks or shared desktop folders, Google Drive is a simple step forward.

name: Hootsuite
description: Schedules and monitors social media posts — helps comms teams plan consistent messaging across platforms.
non_profit_discount: Up to 75% off via HootGiving for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Hootsuite’s HootGiving program to receive up to 75% off Professional or Team plans.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Hootsuite account  
- Visit the [HootGiving page](https://www.hootsuite.com/about/hootgiving) and register with a non-profit verification partner (TechSoup or Percent) to obtain a validation token  
- Submit your application along with the validation token  
- Once verified, Hootsuite will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email

name: HubSpot
description: A CRM with built-in marketing tools — used by non-profits to track donor relationships and send automated email updates.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for HubSpot’s non-profit program to receive a 40% discount on Professional or Enterprise tier products.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free HubSpot account  
- Visit the [HubSpot for non-profits page](https://www.hubspot.com/nonprofits)  
- Click on "[Talk to Sales](https://offers.hubspot.com/contact-sales?hubs_signup-url=www.hubspot.com%2Fnonprofits&hubs_signup-cta=cta_button&hsCtaTracking=3e48e85b-2205-424b-88e0-1acee6862512%7Cae91b765-200e-4e86-904c-29536b502e9e)" to initiate the application process
hs_recommended_details:
HubSpot is a CRM, or contact management system, that helps non-profits keep track of their supporters, volunteers, donors, partners, and anyone else they engage with. If you’ve outgrown spreadsheets and find yourself manually updating lists or losing track of conversations, a CRM like HubSpot can help bring everything into one place.

You can use it to manage emails, forms, and newsletters, and it keeps a clear record of who you’ve spoken to and when. It’s especially helpful for fundraising, community engagement, and building long-term relationships. The free plan has a lot to offer, and the nonprofit discount makes the paid options more accessible if you need extra features.

It takes some time to set up, but once you’re up and running, it helps your team stay organised, communicate consistently, and save time on manual admin.
affiliate_link: Requires the Tools for Non-Profits app to be live, then we apply by email - https://www.hubspot.com/partners/affiliates

name: Humanitix
description: Event ticketing platform that directs booking fees to charity — great for hosting fundraising dinners, workshops, or community events.
pricing_details:
Non-profits, registered charities, and schools can apply for Humanitix’s discounted booking fee rates, allowing you to retain more from your ticket sales while accessing all platform features.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Humanitix account using your organisation’s official email address  
- Click on the chat messenger at the bottom right corner of the Humanitix Help Centre  
- Select "Ask a Question" and type, "Apply for the NFP rate"  
- Respond to the prompts with details about your organisation and event  
- Once verified, Humanitix will apply the discounted rate to your account and notify you by email

name: Jotform
description: Easy-to-use form builder for registrations, donations, or surveys — commonly used for collecting volunteer sign-ups or program feedback.
non_profit_discount: 50% off all paid plans for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Jotform’s non-profit program to receive a 50% discount on Bronze, Silver, or Gold plans.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Jotform account  
- Visit the [Jotform non-profit Pricing page](https://www.jotform.com/nonprofit/pricing/)  
- Click “Claim Your Discount” and complete the application form, including proof of your non-profit status  
- Once verified (typically within 24–48 hours), Jotform will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email

name: Mailchimp
description: Email marketing platform to design, send, and track campaigns — perfect for monthly donor updates or appeal drives.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can get a 15% discount on all paid plans.

How to aply:
- Create a free Mailchimp account on their website  
- Contact the Billing Team and send them your username and a link to your organisation’s website to ask for the discount  
- Once approved, the discount will be added to your account!
hs_recommended_details:
Mailchimp is a powerful tool for sending email updates to your community, volunteers, and donors. We like it because it’s reliable. Your emails actually reach people, which is essential when you're sharing important news or asking for support.

That said, the pricing can grow quickly. As your contact list grows, so does your monthly bill. They offer a 15% discount for non-profits, but it's not the most generous, especially for smaller organisations trying to do a lot with limited resources.

If dependable delivery is your top priority, Mailchimp is a strong option. Just keep an eye on your contact numbers and be prepared for the cost as you grow.

name: MailPoet
description: WordPress plugin for sending newsletters and automations — great for small non-profits managing emails directly from their website.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for MailPoet’s non-profit discount to receive 20% off any MailPoet subscription plan.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your [free MailPoet account](https://account.mailpoet.com/)  
- Prepare proof of your non-profit status, such as official documentation or a public page on your website  
- Contact MailPoet’s sales support via the [Contact Sales Support form](https://account.mailpoet.com/)  
- Include your MailPoet account email and proof of non-profit status in your message  
- Once verified, MailPoet will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email

name: Microsoft Teams
description: Communication and file-sharing hub — helps internal teams and boards stay connected across locations with chat and video.
non_profit_discount: 10 free seats with discounts for additional users for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Microsoft's non-profit program to receive free and discounted access to Microsoft 365, Azure, Dynamics 365, and other cloud services. Eligible organisations may receive grants for Microsoft 365 Business Basic (up to 300 users) and discounts of up to 75% on Microsoft 365 Business Premium and other plans.

**How to apply:**
- Visit the Microsoft Non-profits Portal  
- Click “Register Now” to begin the application process  
- Provide details about your organisation, including proof of non-profit status (e.g., charity registration or equivalent documentation)  
- Microsoft will verify your eligibility, often in partnership with TechSoup  
- Once approved (typically within 3–7 business days), you can access grants and discounts through your non-profit dashboard

name: Monday.com
description: Visual project and task management tool — ideal for organising campaigns, grant applications, or team workflows.
non_profit_discount: 10 free Pro seats with 70% off additional seats for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for monday.com’s non-profit program to receive 10 free Pro plan seats and a 70% discount on additional seats.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free monday.com account  
- Visit the [monday.com non-profit page](https://monday.com/nonprofits)  
- Click “Check your eligibility” and complete the application form with your organisation’s details and proof of non-profit status  
- Once verified (typically within 2–3 business days), monday.com will apply the non-profit plan to your account and notify you by email

name: Notion
description: All-in-one workspace for notes, databases, and wikis — used by non-profits to track goals, manage board documents, or plan events.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Notion’s non-profit program to receive 50% off the Plus plan.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Notion account  
- Visit the [Notion for Nonprofits page](https://www.notion.com/nonprofits), click “[Apply now](https://www.techsoup.org/notion)”  
- Complete the application form, which includes verifying your non-profit status  
- Once verified (typically within 3–5 business days), you'll receive a unique discount code via email  
- Apply the discount code to your Notion workspace to activate the 50% discount on the Plus Plan
hs_recommended_details:
Notion is a flexible workspace tool that can be shaped to fit how your team works. For non-profits, that might mean building a central hub for policies and onboarding, tracking grant applications, managing content calendars, or keeping meeting notes and project plans in one place.

It’s part document editor, part database, and part task manager, and it shines when you need one tool to do a bit of everything. We’ve seen non-profits use it to create public dashboards for transparency, internal knowledge bases, and even lightweight CRMs. The 50% nonprofit discount makes the paid plan more affordable, especially if you’re working across multiple teams or want access to advanced features.

It can take a bit of experimentation to set up your workspace in a way that works for your team, but once it’s in place, Notion becomes a calm, organised home base for everything you're working on.

name: Otter.ai
description: Records and transcribes meetings or interviews — useful for documenting board discussions or recording oral histories.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.

name: Queensland Globe
description: Interactive GIS tool for exploring local land, planning, and environmental data — ideal for conservation groups or advocacy mapping.
pricing_details: This is a completely free tool.

name: Raisely
description: All-in-one fundraising platform — great for running donation campaigns, peer-to-peer events, or long-term supporter drives.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can use Raisely’s fundraising platform for free, with optional donor tips or a flat fee model, and access advanced features through Raisely Pro.

**How to apply:**
- Sign up for a [free Raisely account](https://www.raisely.com/)  
- Choose your preferred fee structure:  
- Default Option: Enable optional donor tips, where donors can choose to add a small amount to their donation to cover platform costs.  
- Flat Fee Option: Opt to pay a flat fee of 4% + GST on all donations, with the ability to customise additional donor tips to cover this fee.  
- Connect your Stripe or PayPal account to process donations.  

Note: Raisely's core platform is free for charities and non-profits, with no setup or subscription fees. Payment processing fees apply through Stripe or PayPal, and organisations may be eligible for non-profit discounts with these providers directly.

name: Salesforce
description: Highly customisable CRM — ideal for large non-profits managing complex donor databases, grants, and outreach at scale.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Salesforce’s Power of Us program to receive 10 free Enterprise Edition licences and significant discounts on additional products and services.

**How to apply:**
- Visit the [Power of Us Program page](https://www.salesforce.com/company/power-of-us/)  
- Click “Log in to apply” and sign in with your Trailblazer ID  
- Complete the application form, providing details about your organisation and proof of non-profit status  
- Once approved (typically within 2–3 weeks), you'll gain access to the Power of Us Portal to select your products and manage your subscriptions

name: Sanity
description: Flexible content platform — used to manage dynamic web content like project updates, blog posts, or case studies collaboratively.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Sanity.io’s non-profit plan to receive free access to the Growth Plan, including 25 user seats, 3 datasets, and SAML SSO.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Sanity.io account and create a project to obtain your Project ID  
- Visit the Sanity Nnon-profit plan page  
- Complete the application form, ensuring you include your valid Sanity Project ID  
- Once verified (typically within 14 business days), Sanity will upgrade your account and notify you by email

name: Slack
description: Real-time messaging platform — useful for coordinating distributed teams, volunteers, and program leads in shared channels.
non_profit_discount: Free upgrade to Pro plan for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Slack’s non-profit program to receive a free upgrade to the Pro plan for workspaces with up to 250 members, or an 85% discount on the Pro or Business+ plans for larger workspaces.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your [free Slack workspace](https://slack.com/intl/en-au/)  
- Visit the [Slack for Nonprofits application page](https://slack.com/intl/en-gb/help/articles/204368833-Apply-for-the-Slack-for-Charities-discount)  
- Complete the application form, providing details about your organisation and proof of nonprofit status  
- Once verified (typically within 3–5 business days), Slack will apply the appropriate discount to your account and notify you by email

name: Softr
description: No-code builder for websites and internal portals — perfect for creating a volunteer dashboard or project directory from Airtable data.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Softr’s non-profit discount to receive 30% off any paid plan.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Softr account  
- Visit the [non-profit discount application form](https://www.softr.io/non-profit-form)  
- Complete the application form, providing details about your organisation and proof of nonprofit status  
- Once verified, Softr will apply the 30% discount to your account and notify you by email
affiliate_link: Available in Partnerstack, need to have Softr products to showcase

name: Square
description: Point-of-sale and online payment solution — used at events, op shops, or donation stations to process payments quickly.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.
hs_recommended_details:
We love Square for its transparent pricing and flexibility, especially for non-profits that need to take payments in different ways. The mobile app is a standout feature because you can take donations or sell merch straight from your phone without needing any extra equipment. This is especially useful at events, markets, or anywhere you're on the move.

Square also offers point-of-sale systems and terminals if you need something more permanent, but starting with the free app is a great option. It integrates with a wide range of other tools, so you can easily add secure payment processing to online forms, booking systems, or donation pages.

name: Stripe
description: Secure online payments platform — commonly used to accept one-off or recurring donations via a website or campaign page.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Stripe’s non-profit discount to receive reduced payment processing fees, helping to maximise the impact of online donations.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Stripe account  
- Email nonprofit@stripe.com with the following information:  
- Proof of your nonprofit status (e.g., ABN or a link to your listing on the ACNC register)  
- Your Stripe account ID  
- The primary email address associated with your Stripe account  
- Confirmation that more than 80% of your payment volume will be tax-deductible donations  
- Once verified (typically within 5–10 business days), Stripe will apply the discounted rates to your account and notify you by email  

Note: In Australia, the discounted rate is 1.4% + A$0.30 for domestic Visa and MasterCard transactions. International and American Express transactions may incur higher fees. This discount applies only to donations; other transactions like ticket sales or membership fees are not eligible.
hs_recommended_details:
Stripe is a solid choice if your non-profit needs to accept payments online. It’s especially useful for things like managing memberships, collecting donations through your website, or sending out invoices for programs or venue hire. You can set up recurring payments for monthly donors or create custom checkout pages without needing to build everything from scratch.

What we like about Stripe is that it handles the complexity in the background and lets you focus on running your organisation. It connects easily with other tools you might already be using, and there’s a nonprofit discount if most of your payments are donations.

It does require a bit of setup though, and if you’re not comfortable with the tech side (or the financial side), you might want help from a developer or someone who’s used it before. But once it’s in place, it’s reliable and flexible, and makes it easier to handle the financial side of things without a big admin burden.

name: Tableau
description: Data visualisation tool — turns program outcomes, survey data, or donor metrics into interactive, shareable dashboards.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Tableau’s non-profit program to receive free Tableau Desktop licences, enabling them to visualise and analyse data to drive impact.

**How to apply:**
- Visit the Tableau Foundation Licence Donations page  
- Click “Request donated licences” and complete the application form with your organisation’s details  
- Provide proof of your nonprofit status, such as a charity registration certificate  
- Once verified (typically within 14 business days), Tableau will provide access to the donated licences and notify you by email  

Note: Eligible organisations must be officially recognised as tax-exempt in their country, operate with an annual budget under $5 million, and not be a school, college, healthcare organisation, government agency, or religious organisation incorporated exclusively for the promotion of religion.

name: Tactiq
description: Captures and summarises video calls — helps staff quickly pull meeting notes or action items from board or partner calls.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.

name: Tally Forms
description: Free, simple form builder — great for collecting volunteer interest, feedback, or workshop sign-ups without limits.
non_profit_discount: 30% off an annual Pro license for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Tally’s non-profit program to receive a 30% lifetime discount on Tally Pro plans.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your [free Tally account](https://tally.cello.so/wJ2k6jDb1S8)  
- Visit the [Tally for non-profit page](https://tally.so/help/tally-for-non-profit) and click “Apply here” and complete the application form  
- Once verified, Tally will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email
hs_recommended_details:
Tally is one of our favourite tools. It’s fresh, clean, and surprisingly powerful for something that feels so simple. It’s perfect for non-profits that need to collect and work with data but don’t want to deal with clunky, overcomplicated form builders.

You can use Tally to handle volunteer sign-ups, program evaluations, event RSVPs, grant reporting, or anything else where you need to gather structured information. Responses can be fed straight into spreadsheets or connected to other tools using integrations, so you don’t end up copying and pasting between systems. It’s especially handy when you want your forms to look good and feel easy for the people filling them out.

Tally offers a nonprofit discount too, which brings the cost down even further. If you’ve ever found yourself wrangling Google Forms or manually consolidating data from five places, Tally might be the clean slate you need.

name: Trello
description: Visual project management using cards and boards — ideal for tracking to-dos across fundraising, events, or programs.
non_profit_discount: Generous free plan available for all
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.
hs_recommended_details:
Trello is one of our favourite tools of all time. If your team needs a clear, visual way to stay organised, Trello is a great place to start. It’s especially helpful for volunteer-based organisations where people come and go, and you need a simple way to show who’s doing what, what’s coming up, and what’s already done.

You can use it to manage projects, track grant applications, plan events, coordinate communications, or even just run your weekly team meetings. The card-based system makes it easy to see the status of tasks at a glance, and you can add checklists, due dates, attachments, and comments so that nothing falls through the cracks.

If your team has never used online workspaces or kanban boards before, there might be a small learning curve. But if you have someone on the team who’s used it before, they can show you the ropes and you’ll be hooked in no time. Trello is a great way to bring structure without the stress.

name: Twilio
description: Communication API for SMS, calls, and WhatsApp — useful for sending donation reminders or event alerts to supporters.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Twilio’s Impact Access Program to receive a one-time USD$100 product credit and ongoing discounts on Twilio services.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Twilio account  
- Visit the [Impact Access Program page](https://www.twilio.org/en-us/support-and-resources/impact-access-program)  
- Complete the application form with your organisation’s details and proof of non-profit status  
- Once verified (typically within 2–5 business days), Twilio will apply the credit and discounts to your account and notify you by email

name: Typeform
description: Sleek, interactive forms — perfect for donor surveys or onboarding forms that feel personal and engaging.
non_profit_discount: 25% off monthly plans and 40% off yearly plans for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Typeform’s non-profit discount to receive 25% off monthly plans or 40% off yearly plans, applied indefinitely.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your [free Typeform account](https://typeform.cello.so/Uj2ciKxoSAv)  
- Visit the [Non-profit, NGO, and Student discounts page](https://help.typeform.com/hc/en-us/articles/360039728951-Non-profit-NGO-and-student-discounts-at-Typeform)  
- Click on the provided form link to request a discount coupon from Typeform’s support team  
- Once verified, you'll receive a coupon code via email to apply to your chosen plan  

Note: The discount applies to the plan type you're subscribed to, either monthly or yearly. Ensure you're on the correct plan before applying the coupon.

name: Vimeo
description: High-quality video hosting — used to present campaigns, testimonials, or virtual events in a polished format.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.
hs_recommended_details:
Vimeo is a great option for non-profits looking for a clean, ad-free way to host and share videos. While there’s no nonprofit discount at the moment, the free plan is still a solid starting point, especially if you’re just getting into video content.

One of the reasons we prefer Vimeo over YouTube is the viewing experience. There are no ads, no distractions, and you have more control over how your videos are embedded and displayed on your website. This makes it a great choice for hosting things like campaign videos, project updates, training materials, or board inductions.

You can also password-protect videos or make them private, which is handy for internal comms, member-only content, or sharing updates with funders. If your team is starting to build a content library and wants a more polished home for video, Vimeo is a solid choice that keeps things professional and distraction-free.

name: WhatsApp
description: Direct messaging app — allows rapid updates and engagement with communities, especially where email is underused.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.

name: Wix
description: Drag-and-drop website builder — easy for small non-profits to create a polished site without coding.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Wix’s non-profit discount to receive 70% off a 2-year Premium plan, including a free 1-year domain registration voucher.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Wix account  
- Visit the Premium Plan Discount for Charities or Non-Profit Organisations page  
- Verify your non-profit status through [ConnectingUp](https://www.connectingup.org/products/partner/Wix)  
- Once verified, you'll receive a coupon code to apply the discount to your account

name: WordPress
description: Open-source CMS — widely used for building scalable non-profit websites with donation, blog, and volunteer features.
non_profit_discount: Free platform for all (open-source); Hosting is not free
pricing_details:
Non-profits can utilise WordPress.org to build and manage their websites at no cost, leveraging its open-source platform and extensive community support.

**How to apply:**
- Visit WordPress.org to download the free WordPress software  
- Choose a hosting provider; some offer discounts or free plans for non-profits  
- Install WordPress on your hosting account and select a theme suitable for non-profits

name: YouTube
description: Public video hosting platform — great for showcasing your mission, stories, and program impact to a broad audience.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for the YouTube non-profit program to access special features that help amplify their mission, including donation buttons, link overlays, and access to YouTube Spaces (in select locations).

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard

name: Zapier
description: Connects apps to automate workflows — helps automate email lists, form responses, or CRM updates without code.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Zapier’s non-profit discount to receive 15% off any paid plan.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Zapier account  
- Visit the [Zapier for non-profits page](https://zapier.com/non-profits)  
- Complete the application form, providing proof of your non-profit status  
- Once verified, Zapier will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email
hs_recommended_details:
Zapier is a powerful tool for non-profits that want to automate repetitive tasks and save time. You can use it to connect the different apps your team already uses, like moving form responses into a spreadsheet, sending welcome emails to new volunteers, or syncing contact data between platforms. It takes a lot of the manual work out of your day-to-day operations.

That said, there are a couple of things to watch. Pricing can creep up quickly if you’re running lots of automations or using premium apps. And it’s important that someone on your team knows what’s running and can troubleshoot if something breaks. It’s not a set-and-forget tool, and things can get messy if no one’s keeping an eye on it.

Once you’ve got the right setup, it can make a huge difference in reducing admin and letting your team focus on the real work. If you’re not sure where to start, Heaps Smart can help you get up and running with automation.

name: Zoho CRM
description: Budget-friendly CRM with AI features — ideal for tracking donors, automating comms, and managing supporter data.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Zoho CRM’s non-profit discount to receive up to 25% off eligible plans.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Zoho CRM account  
- Send an email to sales@zohocorp.com requesting the non-profit discount  
- Include proof of your non-profit status, such as a charity registration certificate or equivalent documentation  
- Once verified, Zoho will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email

name: Zoom
description: Video meeting platform — widely used for virtual board meetings, webinars, and training sessions.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Zoom’s non-profit discount to receive 50% off select Zoom products, including Zoom Workplace Pro, Zoom Workplace Business, Zoom Webinars, and Large Meeting add-ons.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Zoom account  
- Visit the Zoom Cares page  
- Under the "Get 50% off select Zoom products" section, select your operating budget  
- Complete the non-profit verification process through Zoom's partner, Goodstack, by providing your organisation's details and proof of status  
- Once verified (typically within 2–3 business days), you'll receive a coupon code to apply the discount to your account
hs_recommended_details:
Zoom is a premium video conferencing option that really shines when you’re hosting larger meetings, webinars, or virtual events. While it’s not free like Google Meet, the nonprofit discount makes it more accessible, and you get extra features that can be worth it depending on how you run your programs or engage your community.

It’s great for board meetings, donor updates, training sessions, or multi-session events. Zoom’s webinar and breakout room features give you more control over the experience, which can make things feel more polished and professional. You can run Q&As, take polls, split participants into smaller groups, or stream to Facebook or YouTube.

Compared to Google Meet, Zoom gives you more options for customisation and managing large groups, but it does come with a bit more setup and cost. For non-profits running public events, training sessions, or multi-organisation meetings, Zoom is often the better fit.

name: Calendly
description: Public scheduling link — makes it easy for partners or volunteers to book time with you, with automatic reminders.
non_profit_discount: 25% off the Standard or Team plan for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Calendly’s non-profit discount to receive 25% off annual plans.

**How to apply:**
- Set up your free Calendly account  
- Contact Calendly’s support team at support@calendly.com  
- Provide proof of your non-profit status  
- Once verified, Calendly will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email
hs_recommended_details:
Calendly is one of the easiest and most user-friendly scheduling tools out there. It’s perfect if your non-profit regularly books appointments, meetings, or interviews and wants to avoid the back-and-forth of email. It syncs with your calendar, lets people book a time that suits them, and handles reminders automatically.

That said, as a stand-alone tool, it comes with a price tag that’s hard to justify for smaller teams already using Google Calendar. Google’s free appointment slots feature covers the basics well, especially for internal use.

Where Calendly stands out is when you need to set up multiple booking types, route bookings to different staff members, manage group events, or collect information at the time of booking. It also offers a cleaner booking experience, custom questions, and more control over availability, which can be helpful for programs like volunteer inductions, donor check-ins, or student mentoring.

If your team handles a high volume of external bookings and needs something polished and reliable, Calendly is a strong option. For everything else, Google might get the job done.

name: Google Calendar
description: Built-in scheduling tool — lets people book from your calendar using defined time slots, ideal for intake calls or donor chats.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Workspace for non-profits to receive free access to essential productivity tools, including Gmail, Google Drive, Google Meet, and more. Discounted rates are also available for Business Standard, Business Plus, and Enterprise editions.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details:
Google Calendar is one of those tools that seems simple at first, but ends up solving all sorts of problems for non-profits. It’s included with Google Workspace for Nonprofits and works beautifully across teams, making it easy to stay on top of meetings, events, and deadlines.

One use we love is turning Calendar into a booking system for shared spaces. For example, we recently helped a non-profit use it to manage room hire for their community space. No more manual bookings, phone calls, or chasing up payments. It streamlined the whole process.

Beyond that, shared calendars are great for scheduling all-staff events, volunteer shifts, board meetings, or public-facing events like workshops and community gatherings. You can create different calendars for different teams or locations, and embed public calendars into your website so the community always knows what’s on. It’s simple, free, and surprisingly powerful once you start using it fully.

name: Supabase
description: Supabase is an open-source backend platform that non-profits can use to build custom apps or databases for things like research projects, citizen science, or program tracking.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.
hs_recommended_details:
Supabase is a great option for non-profits building custom tools, apps, or data platforms. It gives you a hosted backend with a real-time database, user authentication, and file storage, all in one place. If you’re working with a developer or a tech-savvy team member, Supabase can save you hours of setup time compared to building everything from scratch.

We like Supabase because it’s open-source, generous on the free tier, and easy to scale up as your needs grow. It’s great for projects like citizen science apps, internal reporting dashboards, or managing member data for custom platforms. It’s also a good alternative to Firebase, especially if you prefer open standards and SQL over proprietary tools.

This isn’t a plug-and-play option for most non-profits, but if you’re exploring digital products or research tools, Supabase is one of the most developer-friendly ways to get started.

name: Buffer
description: Buffer is a social media scheduling tool that helps non-profits plan, publish, and manage posts across multiple platforms from one place.
non_profit_discount: 50% off all paid plans for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits receive 50% off all paid plans.

**How to apply:**
- Start a [free trial](https://buffer.com/join/ab5dc7ac8208fd661ed747ab8d0ad5f144dc78a788be3f50367ae705c8e6604e)  
- Complete the [non-profit discount request form](https://buffer.com/nonprofits#completeform)  
- Provide documentation verifying your non-profit status  
- Once verified, Buffer will apply the discount to your account and notify you by email
hs_recommended_details:
Buffer is a helpful tool for non-profits managing social media across multiple platforms. It lets you draft, schedule, and publish posts ahead of time, so you’re not scrambling to post on the day of your event or campaign. If you’re working with a small team or volunteers helping with communications, Buffer makes it easy to plan and review content in one place.

It’s great not just for managing your organisation’s accounts, but also for supporting key team members who have a public presence — like your CEO, Community Lead, or program managers. You can queue up posts for their profiles, maintain consistent messaging, and help them stay visible without needing to be online every day.

The free plan covers a lot, and the nonprofit discount helps if you need more features like analytics or team access. It’s not the most advanced platform out there, but its simplicity is part of the appeal. If you’re juggling Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and maybe even Threads or X, Buffer keeps things clear and manageable for everyone involved.

name: n8n
description: n8n is an open-source automation tool that lets non-profits connect apps and automate tasks like syncing data between forms, CRMs, and email platforms.
pricing_details: There are no non-profit discounts.
hs_recommended_details:
n8n is a powerful automation tool for non-profits that want to connect different apps and systems without relying on expensive platforms. It’s similar to Zapier in what it can do — moving data between tools, triggering emails, updating databases — but with more flexibility and no per-task pricing.

Where n8n really shines is if your non-profit has a tech-savvy team member or developer who can set up workflows. You can host it yourself for free, or use the cloud version, and it works with hundreds of tools like Airtable, Google Sheets, Mailchimp, and CRMs. We've used it to automate newsletters, sync volunteer sign-up data, and even route HR requests into Kanban boards.

It’s not the best option if you're looking for a plug-and-play interface. But if you want full control over your automations and are ready to get a bit technical, n8n is one of the most affordable and flexible options out there.

name: Google Docs
description: Google Docs is a free, cloud-based word processor that non-profits can use to collaborate on documents like grant applications, meeting notes, and reports in real time.
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for Google Workspace for non-profits to receive free access to essential productivity tools, including Gmail, Google Drive, Google Meet, and more. Discounted rates are also available for Business Standard, Business Plus, and Enterprise editions.

**How to apply:**
- Set up a free Google account for your workspace admin  
- Visit the [Google for non-profits website](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/) and click 'Get Started'  
- Sign in with your workspace admin's Google account and complete the [eligibility form](https://www.google.com/nonprofits/account/u/0/signup)  
- Wait for verification by Google's partner, which typically takes 2–14 business days  
- Once approved, activate Google Workspace for non-profits from your account dashboard
hs_recommended_details:
Google Docs is probably already part of your toolkit, but it’s worth getting to know a few of the lesser-known features that make it especially useful for non-profits. It’s a good tool for collaboration, especially if your team is spread out or working part-time.

You can add checklists to documents, which is helpful for shared agendas, action items, or onboarding steps. There’s also a simple eSignature tool built in, which can be a quick solution for signing internal documents without needing a separate platform. If you're reviewing policies or writing grants as a group, the commenting and suggestion tools help keep everyone on the same page.

Docs isn’t flashy, but it does a lot quietly in the background. It’s free with Google Workspace for Nonprofits and gives your team a shared space to work together without worrying about version control or who has the latest file.

name: Xero
description: Xero is cloud-based accounting software that helps non-profits manage finances, track expenses, send invoices, and simplify bookkeeping with helpful integrations.
pricing_details:
Non-profits receive 25% off Business Edition plans.

**How to apply:**
- Sign up for a free trial or paid Xero plan  
- Log in to Xero Central and raise a support case  
- Provide proof of your non-profit status  
- Once verified, Xero will apply the discount and notify you by email
hs_recommended_details:
While we're not accountants, we believe Xero is a solid choice for non-profits that want to stay on top of their finances without a full-time bookkeeper. It’s great for smaller teams because it simplifies tasks like tracking expenses, sending invoices, managing payroll, and reconciling bank accounts. The interface is clean, and it’s easy to share access with your accountant or treasurer. There’s also a non-profit discount available, which helps keep it affordable as your organization grows.

One of the strengths of Xero is its extensive integration capabilities. For instance, it connects with donor management tools like Keela and Infoodle, allowing you to sync donor data and streamline fundraising efforts. If your non-profit uses platforms like Stripe or PayPal for online donations, Xero can integrate with these to automatically record transactions, reducing manual data entry.

These integrations help non-profits automate routine tasks, maintain accurate records, and focus more on their mission rather than administrative work.

name: Quickbooks
description: QuickBooks is accounting software that non-profits can use to manage budgets, track donations and grants, run payroll, and generate financial reports for compliance and board reporting.
non_profit_discount: 50% off the first 3 months for non-profits
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for QuickBooks’ non-profit discount to receive 50% off for 6 months.

**How to apply:**
1. Choose a QuickBooks Online plan (Plus or Advanced is recommended)
2. Call the QuickBooks team on 1800 917 771
3. Provide proof of your non-profit or charity status
4. Once verified, QuickBooks will apply the discount to your account

name: MYOB
description: MYOB is accounting software that supports non-profits with tasks like payroll, expense tracking, and budgeting, and is especially useful for organisations operating in Australia and New Zealand.
non_profit_discount: Discounts available for non-profits. Currently offering buy 1 month / get 6 months free
pricing_details:
Non-profits can apply for MYOB’s non-profit discount through Connecting Up to receive reduced pricing on MYOB Business plans.

**How to apply:**
- Create a free account at connectingup.org  
- Register your organisation and provide proof of non-profit status  
- Once approved, log in and access MYOB offers through the Connecting Up portal  
- Complete your MYOB purchase via Connecting Up to apply the discount

name: Squarespace
description: Squarespace is a website builder that non-profits can use to create clean, professional websites with built-in tools for blogging, donations, event pages, and email signups.
non_profit_discount: 10% off first payment with code NONPROFIT
pricing_details:
Non-profits receive a 10% discount on their first annual Squarespace plan.

**How to apply:**
- Visit squarespace.com and start a free trial  
- Choose a plan that fits your needs and proceed to checkout  
- Enter the code NONPROFIT in the "Offer Code" field  

Note: The 10% discount will be applied to your first payment only.

name: Keela
description: All-in-one fundraising CRM designed specifically for non-profits — helps manage donors, track giving patterns, and run targeted campaigns.
non_profit_discount: Built for non-profits with scaled pricing
pricing_details:
Keela offers tiered pricing based on the number of contacts in your database, starting from $79 USD/month for up to 1,000 contacts.

**How to get started:**
- Visit the Keela website and request a demo
- Choose a plan based on your contact database size
- Keela offers onboarding support and training to help you get set up
- Pricing scales with your organization's size rather than offering traditional non-profit discounts
hs_recommended_details:
Keela is purpose-built for non-profits, which means it understands the unique needs of fundraising organizations right out of the box. Unlike general CRMs that you have to adapt, Keela includes features like donor segmentation, gift tracking, campaign management, and reporting dashboards designed specifically for fundraising teams.

It's particularly strong for organizations that are ready to move beyond spreadsheets and basic tools but aren't quite ready for enterprise-level platforms like Salesforce. The built-in email marketing, online donation forms, and volunteer management features mean you can consolidate several tools into one platform.

The pricing is higher than general CRMs, but it includes specialized features that would otherwise require multiple subscriptions. It's worth considering if fundraising is a major part of your operations and you want a system that speaks your language from day one.
